<!-- Generated by Harlequin Webmaker 2.1.3; Transducer 1.0.2 --> <HTML> <HEAD> <TITLE> J&ouml;rg Peters</TITLE> </HEAD> <BODY> <A NAME=HEADING34></A> <A HREF="AR95Book-35.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Bnext.gif"></A><A HREF="AR95Book-33.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Bprev.gif"></A><A HREF="AR95Book-6.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Bup.gif"></A><A HREF="AR95Book-1.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Btop.gif"></A><A HREF="AR95Book-2.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Bcontent.gif"></A><BR><A HREF="AR95Book-35.html">[Next] </A><A HREF="AR95Book-33.html">[Previous] </A><A HREF="AR95Book-6.html">[Up] </A><A HREF="AR95Book-1.html">[Top] </A><A HREF="AR95Book-2.html">[Contents]</A> <P> <IMG SRC="images/jorg.gif"><P> <A NAME=HEADING34-0></A> <H1> <A NAME=MARKER-9-60></A><A NAME=MARKER-10-61></A>J&ouml;rg Peters</H1> <IMG SRC="goldRule.gif" width =100%> <P> <EM> Assistant Professor of Computer Sciences (1992)</EM><P> <EM> Ph. D., University of Wisconsin-Madison, 1990</EM><P> Dr. Peters is interested in representing and analyzing geometry on the computer. He has developed new tools for free-form modeling and design that can be viewed as a language for describing geometric entities, curves and surfaces, in a succinct form. Short representations of geometry are fundamental to scientific visualization, animation and graphics, virtual reality, virtual prototyping of manufacturable objects and approximation theory. For examples, please see http://www.cs.purdue.edu/people/jorg.<P> In 1994, Dr. Peters was honored with a five year National Young Investigator Award. In 1991 and 1992 he held positions at the IBM T.J. Watson Research Center and Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute.<P> Projects: <A HREF=AR95Book-109.html>Foundations and Tools for Surface Modeling</A> <P> <A HREF="http://www.cs.purdue.edu/people/jorg"> Peters's home page </A><P> <IMG SRC="goldRule.gif" width =100%> <ADDRESS>CS Annual Report - 19 APR 1996</ADDRESS> <A HREF="AR95Book-35.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Bnext.gif"></A><A HREF="AR95Book-33.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Bprev.gif"></A><A HREF="AR95Book-6.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Bup.gif"></A><A HREF="AR95Book-1.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Btop.gif"></A><A HREF="AR95Book-2.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Bcontent.gif"></A><BR><A HREF="AR95Book-35.html">[Next] </A><A HREF="AR95Book-33.html">[Previous] </A><A HREF="AR95Book-6.html">[Up] </A><A HREF="AR95Book-1.html">[Top] </A><A HREF="AR95Book-2.html">[Contents]</A> <P> </BODY> </HTML> </HTML>
